_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Platte Valley Fuel Ethanol, Inc.

Platte Valley Fuel Ethanol, Inc. is a newly constructed facility.  Many of the reports and information have only recently been developed.  Given that Platte Valley Fuel Ethanol, Inc. is a new facility, there has been constant review and revisions to reports and information prior to the start up of the facility.  On the same note, there has never been a change in management.  The management is "new" and therefore, the "new" management was implemented with the construction of the facility. 

Accidental Release Prevention and Response Policies:

Platte Valley Fuel Ethanol, Inc. has a commitment to worker and public safety.  This commitment is demonstrated in the resources invested in accident prevention, such as training personnel as well as considering safety in the design, installation, operation, and maintenance of the facility.

Platte Valley Fuel Ethanol, Inc.'s policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances.  However, if a release does occur, plant personnel will respond to contain the release as necessary.

Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances:

Platte Valley Fuel Ethanol, Inc. ethanol plant is located near Central City, Merrick County, Nebraska.

The facility operates 24 hours per day, 7 days per week for the purpose of manufacturing fuel grade ethanol from corn.  The regulated substance under the RMP program is Anhydrous Ammonia.  Platte Valley Fuel Ethanol, Inc. has determined that the radius of impact from a worst-case release would be about 5.6 miles; due to the amount of ammonia stored on site.

Off-site Consequence Analysis Results:

The worst case scenario at the facility is the release of all 97,200 pounds of ammonia creating a toxic cloud.  The worst-case scenario is based on the release of all ammonia stored on site.  The worst case vapor cloud endpoint is approximately 5.6 miles from the center of the p

lant.  Public receptors are located within this 5.6 mile radius.

Although Platte Valley Fuel Ethanol, Inc. has numerous controls in place to prevent such a release and to manage potential consequences, no credit for administrative controls or passive mitigation measures were taken into account in evaluating this scenario.

Since the facility qualifies as a Program 3 due to the close proximity of public receptors, Program Safety Management has to be completed for this facility.

Five Year Accident History:

Platte Valley Fuel Ethanol, Inc. has constructed a new ethanol facility and is subject to RMP upon delivery of substances onsite.

Emergency Response Program Information:

The Platte Valley Fuel Ethanol, Inc. ethanol plant has several safety programs in place at the facility that incorporate emergency response, including a Health and Safety Plan.  An SPCC will be prepared and implemented in accordance with applicable regulatory standards and timeframes.

The facility also conducts employee training as part of facility activities.  Platte Valley Fuel Ethanol, Inc.'s corporate policy places the utmost importance on worker, public and environmental safety, which is reflected in facility plans and training activities.

A safety inspection and review of the facility's emergency response plan is pending.
